verses.kjv: Israel is an empty vine, he bringeth forth fruit unto himself: according to the multitude of his fruit he hath increased the altars; according to the goodness of his land they have made goodly images.
verses.ct: Israel is a vine that has gone wild, producing fruit only for itself. The more fruit it produced, the more altars it built. The more prosperous the land became, the more elaborate they made their sacred pillars.

verses.kjv: Their heart is divided; now shall they be found faulty: he shall break down their altars, he shall spoil their images.
verses.ct: Their loyalty is split. Now they will be held accountable. God will tear down their altars and destroy their sacred pillars.

verses.kjv: For now they shall say, We have no king, because we feared not the LORD; what then should a king do to us?
verses.ct: Then they will say, 'We have no king, because we were not wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD. But what could a king even do for us?'

verses.kjv: They have spoken words, swearing falsely in making a covenant: thus judgment springeth up as hemlock in the furrows of the field.
verses.ct: They make empty promises, swearing false oaths when making agreements. So justice has turned poisonous, sprouting like toxic weeds in a plowed field.

verses.kjv: The inhabitants of Samaria shall fear because of the calves of Bethaven: for the people thereof shall mourn over it, and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it, for the glory thereof, because it is departed from it.
verses.ct: The people of Samaria will tremble over the calf-idol of Beth-aven. Its worshipers will grieve over it, and its priests who once celebrated its glory will wail, because that glory has been taken away from it.

verses.kjv: It shall be also carried unto Assyria for a present to king Jareb: Ephraim shall receive shame, and Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
verses.ct: The idol itself will be carried off to Assyria as a gift for the great king. Ephraim will be humiliated, and Israel will be disgraced by its own plans.

verses.kjv: As for Samaria, her king is cut off as the foam upon the water.
verses.ct: Samaria's king will be swept away like a twig floating on the surface of the water.

verses.kjv: The high places also of Aven, the sin of Israel, shall be destroyed: the thorn and the thistle shall come up on their altars; and they shall say to the mountains, Cover us; and to the hills, Fall on us.
verses.ct: The worship sites of Aven — Israel's sin — will be demolished. Thorns and thistles will grow over their altars. Then they will cry out to the mountains, 'Bury us!' and to the hills, 'Collapse on top of us!'

verses.kjv: O Israel, thou hast sinned from the days of Gibeah: there they stood: the battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity did not overtake them.
verses.ct: Israel, you have been sinning ever since the days of Gibeah. There they took their stand. Did not war overtake the wicked ones at Gibeah?

verses.kjv: It is in my desire that I should chastise them; and the people shall be gathered against them, when they shall bind themselves in their two furrows.
verses.ct: When I choose, I will discipline them. Nations will be assembled against them to punish them for their double sin.

verses.kjv: And Ephraim is as an heifer that is taught, and loveth to tread out the corn; but I passed over upon her fair neck: I will make Ephraim to ride; Judah shall plow, and Jacob shall break his clods.
verses.ct: Ephraim was like a trained young cow that loved treading out the grain. But I will put a yoke on her beautiful neck. I will harness Ephraim to pull heavy loads; Judah must plow, and Jacob must break up the soil.

verses.kjv: Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for it is time to seek the LORD, till he come and rain righteousness upon you.
verses.ct: Plant seeds of righteousness for yourselves, and harvest the fruit of mercy. Break up your unplowed ground, because now is the time to seek the LORD, until he comes and showers righteousness down on you.

verses.kjv: Ye have plowed wickedness, ye have reaped iniquity; ye have eaten the fruit of lies: because thou didst trust in thy way, in the multitude of thy mighty men.
verses.ct: But you have planted wickedness, harvested injustice, and eaten the fruit of deception — because you trusted in your own strategies and in your many warriors.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall a tumult arise among thy people, and all thy fortresses shall be spoiled, as Shalman spoiled Betharbel in the day of battle: the mother was dashed in pieces upon her children.
verses.ct: So the roar of battle will rise against your people, and all your fortified cities will be demolished, just as Shalman devastated Beth-arbel on the day of battle, when mothers were crushed alongside their children.

verses.kjv: So shall Bethel do unto you because of your great wickedness: in a morning shall the king of Israel utterly be cut off.
verses.ct: This is what will happen to you, Bethel, because of your extreme wickedness. When that day dawns, the king of Israel will be completely destroyed.
